item.title: Debian /etc/cron.d/ gotcha
item.description: I typically use /etc/cron.d to store all of my system crontabs. I recently ran into an issue that I had either not run into before, or fixed and paid no attention to. Files stored in /etc/cron.d/ or any /etc/cron.* directory need to adhear to the run-parts Debian cron script namespace which consists is (^[a-z0-9][a-z0-9-]*$) for the regex impared this does not include the dot character.
